title: Duke and Duchess of Sussex show backing for anti-Trump wall charity
text:
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have indicated their support for a Californian migrant charity that opposes what it calls Donald Trump’s “shameful” border wall plan.

The couple have chosen to highlight a number of different charities on their Instagram page each month, championing causes close to their hearts.

The latest theme of “community” saw them follow a broad range of organisations, from a small support group for maternal mental health in Essex to a Tanzanian children’s home, a riding stables for the disabled and an all-female black mamba anti-poaching unit.

One of the accounts the couple “followed” is that of Border Kindness, a charity founded just last year in direct response to the US President’s controversial plan to build a wall on the Mexico border.

Before she married into the Royal Family, the Duchess of Sussex made her personal views about Mr Trump clear, accusing him of being “misogynistic” and “divisive” during his 2016 presidential campaign.

Her support for Border Kindness comes just days after Prince Harry announced he stood shoulder-to-shoulder with teenage climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, who was last month mocked by the US President.
